noun.description: An artificial narrowing or turn on a road or auto-racing course.
examples: the Austrian's car flew out of control and spun across the chicane

noun.description: (in card games) a hand without cards of one particular suit; a void.

examples: he spends more time chicaning on texts than invoking principles

origin: Late 17th century (in the senses chicanery and use chicanery): from French chicane (noun), chicaner (verb) quibble, of unknown origin.
